meanings.sent1: The warm, cozy nest provided an incubative environment for the eggs to hatch.
meanings.sent2: The mother bird's incubative care ensured the eggs would soon hatch into chicks.
meanings.sent3: The incubative heat of the sun made the sleepy cat doze off in contentment.
meanings.sent4: Her incubative love for gardening blossomed into a beautiful array of flowers.
meanings.sent5: The incubative warmth of the fireplace filled the room with a comforting glow.

meanings.definition: Capable of causing or promoting incubation
meanings.sent1: The incubative heat lamp helped the chicks stay warm and grow strong.
meanings.sent2: The incubative properties of the compost sped up the growth of the plants.
meanings.sent3: His incubative idea sparked a wave of creativity among his friends.
meanings.sent4: The incubative nature of her words planted the seed of doubt in his mind.
meanings.sent5: The incubative atmosphere in the classroom encouraged lively discussions among the students.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the process of incubation
meanings.sent1: The incubative period for the eggs was carefully monitored by the scientists.
meanings.sent2: The farmer adjusted the incubative conditions to ensure successful hatching.
meanings.sent3: The incubative chamber hummed softly as it maintained the perfect temperature.
meanings.sent4: The incubative process of fermentation transformed the dough into delicious bread.
meanings.sent5: The incubative cycle of the butterfly fascinated the young children at the nature center.
